alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:06AM EDT until August 30 at 10:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Suwanee Creek at Suwanee. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at U S Highway 23 or Buford Highway. Most of the Suwanee Creek Greenway and trails are flooded from the Suwanee Creek Park to George Pierce Park. The minor flooding will also begin to affect portions of the playground area behind the Suwanee Elementary School. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EDT Wednesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM EDT.
